title: Composing Templates & Functions
text: ggpackets powerful ’s used build template functions. using framework packaging components ggplot single object, provides simple framework constructing full featured ggplot wrappers. importantly, handle wealth ggplot-naitive parameters, exposing complete control components plot minimal added syntax. ’s say work done - elegantly handle parameters intuitively minimal syntactic burden end user, might amount argument handling order satisfy ideal user interface. goal allow programmer focus building around usability function instead nuances constructing plots handling interactivity extensible ggplot ecosystem.

title: Composing Templates & Functions
text: First, get far along, ggpackets nearly useless without components ggplot2. Let’s get loaded. build first template, ’ll simply add layers ggpacket object. ’ll specify aesthetic parameters - size line layer (geom_line()) point layer (geom_point()).  Although might helpful making quick, reusable code, provide much flexibility intents purposes equivalent list(geom_line(size = 1), geom_point(size = 3)). Perhaps syntax little familiar use ggplot regularly, aside , simplist form provides little real value.
code: library(ggplot2) ggpk_my_template <- ggpacket() +    geom_line(size = 1) +    geom_point(size = 3) ggplot(Loblolly) +    aes(x = age, y = height, color = Seed) +    ggpk_my_template() +    ggtitle('Growth of Loblolly Pines')

what: Wrapping a template in a function
title: Composing Templates & Functions
text: power ggpackets begins shine transparent argument handling. want bundle function , also want provide optional handling additional ggplot parameters, ggpackets provides much functionality little additional syntax. use ggpack() function articulate parameters layer lump extra paramaters passed function.  function declared , arguments passed wrapper function get filter internal layers. pass ..., pass unnamed arguments parent function. fact, call function, can pass arguments typically get passed either ggplot functions wrapped inside , geom_line geom_point. choose pass data mapping parameters (typically set using ggplot() aes() functions constructing ggplot object), even use standalone function shown . aware usage isn’t particularly intuitive without bit added documentation. ’re building function someone else use export package ’re making, ’s probably worth writing good documentation parameters expect people use.
code: ggpk_my_template <- function(...) {   ggpacket(...) %+%     geom_line(size = 1, ...) %+%     geom_point(size = 3, ...) } ggplot(Loblolly) +    aes(x = age, y = height) +    ggpk_my_template(aes(color = age), stat = 'summary', fun.data = mean_se, size = 5, alpha = 0.5) +    ggtitle('Average Growth of Loblolly Pines') ggpk_my_template(   data = Loblolly,   mapping = aes(x = age, y = height, color = Seed))

title: Composing Templates & Functions
text: one lingering issue. case, parameters passed ggplot layers wrapped inside function. can see impact issue , size (thickness) lines size (diameter) points changed set new size. want control one independently, need precise way passing parameters. can addressed adding identifying string layers using id parameter ggpack(). want restrict parameters one layer another, ggpackets can handle filtering parameters layers parsing parameters prefixes match particular layer’s id. example, layer id = 'my_ggplot_layer', might pass function parameter like my_ggplot_layer.size (id parameter name separated period) set size parameter particular layer without affecting others.  Lists also permitted id, allowing one number different prefixes capture arguments particular layer.
code: ggpk_my_template <- function(...) {   ggpacket() %+%   geom_line(.id = 'line', size = 1, ...) %+%    geom_point(.id = 'point', size = 3, ...) } ggplot(Loblolly) +    aes(x = age, y = height, color = Seed) +    ggpk_my_template(point.size = 5, line.size = 0.5) +    ggtitle('Average Growth of Loblolly Pines') ggpk_my_template <- function(...) {   ggpacket() %+%   geom_line(.id = c('all', 'line'), size = 1, ...) %+%   geom_point(.id = c('all', 'point'), size = 3, ...) } ggplot(Loblolly) +    aes(x = age, y = height) +    ggpk_my_template(stat = 'summary', fun.data = mean_se,     point.size = 5, line.size = 0.5) +    ggtitle('Average Growth of Loblolly Pines')

title: Composing Templates & Functions
text: ordering parameters passed layer carries significance can used exercise control function operates. parameter passed layer , last instance always takes priority. includes parameters passed list via dots parameter. allows calls constructed way dictates arguments set stone can ovewritten user. Take example following function ellipses parameters passed layers using dots parameter. first layer, size declared parameters passed user, whereas second size passed user parameters. user able set size line layer, unable change size point layer last size parameter always take precedent (even ’s passed prefix, like point.size). gives considerable control impact user can plot template.
code: ggpk_my_template <- function(...) {   ggpacket() %+%   geom_line(.id = 'line', size = 3, ...) %+%   geom_point(.id = 'point', ..., size = 3) } ggplot(Loblolly) +    aes(x = age, y = height, color = Seed) +    ggpk_my_template(line.size = 0.1, point.size = 10) +    ggtitle('Average Growth of Loblolly Pines')

title: Getting Started with `ggpackets`
text: ggpackets aims make ggplot plots modular adding framework packing groups ggplot layers can stored single variable accessed function call. means can now easily build template plots still interact nicely ggplot syntax. illustrate functionality, let’s start trivial example.

title: Getting Started with `ggpackets`
text: start, let’s take look might take build bar plot showing mean value group errorbars represent standard deviation counts bar labelled base bar. ’ll start building plot using standard ggplot.  Wow! plot got hand fast. can see ’s lot repeated code. know want use exact code repeatedly, wrap function make bit reusable, ’d sacrafice lot customizability building plot scratch minor modifications instance. Alternatively, use ggpackets, provide functionality interoperate ggplot layers.
code: library(ggplot2) ggplot(mtcars) +    aes(x = carb, y = mpg) +    geom_bar(stat= 'summary', aes(y = mpg),      fun.data = function(c) c(y = mean(c))) +    geom_errorbar(stat = 'summary', aes(y = mpg), width = 0.2,     fun.y = mean,     fun.min = ~mean(.) - sd(.),     fun.max = ~mean(.) + sd(.)) +    geom_text(stat = 'summary', vjust = -0.5, color = 'white',     fun.data = function(c) c(       label = length(c),        y = 0))

title: Getting Started with `ggpackets`
text: straightforward form, ggpackets allows packing multiple layers together single variable. variable contains ggppacket object. class handles addition ggpacket objects ggproto objects append contents internal list ggproto layers ( ggproto objects result geom_* stat_* functions ggplot2). ’s combined ggplot call build plot (starting function ggplot()), ggpacket add layers ggplot.

title: Getting Started with `ggpackets`
text: breaking layers plot, still retain full control additional layers might needed variables used produce plot without needing add extensive argument handling function.
code: my_ggpk_layers <- ggpacket() +    geom_bar(stat = 'summary',      fun.data = function(c) c(y = mean(c))) +    geom_errorbar(stat = 'summary', width = 0.2,     fun.data = function(c) c(       y = mean(c),       ymin = mean(c) - sd(c),       ymax = mean(c) + sd(c))) +   geom_text(stat = 'summary', vjust = -0.5,     color = 'white',     fun.data = function(c) c(label = length(c), y = 0)) ggplot(mtcars) +    aes(x = carb, y = mpg, fill = as.factor(am)) +    my_ggpk_layers() +    facet_grid(. ~ am, scales = 'free')

title: Getting Started with `ggpackets`
text: Using ggpacket() build packet layers, get bunch flexibility provide modifications base ggplot layers minor change code. Let’s say instead want bit fine-grained control explicit behavior custom plot. straightforward usage ggpackets might suffice might turn function fullfil needs. point, wrapping original ggplot call function starts become pretty appealing.  Looking pretty good! Let’s consider, however, still want flexibility edit color bars throughout analysis, change function used determine errorbars, facet plot multiple groups. One way include additional arguments new function pass plot. Every additional argument requires fair bit tweaking function ’s fairly easy imagine scope function growing quickly hand. Alternatively, wrap ggplot layers list use ggplot, ’d constrained parameters initially defined list.
code: my_plot <- function(data, x, y, fun.data = mean_se) {   ggplot(data) +      aes_string(x = x, y = y) +          geom_bar(stat= 'summary',        aes_string(y = y),        fun.data = fun.data) +           geom_errorbar(       stat = 'summary',        aes_string(y = y),        width = 0.2,       fun.data = fun.data) +          geom_text(       stat = 'summary',        color = 'white',       vjust = -0.5,        fun.data = function(c) c(label = length(c), y = 0)) } my_plot(mtcars, 'carb', 'wt')

title: Getting Started with `ggpackets`
text: ggpackets aims reduce inevitable issue making simple possible build types reusable code snippets.  Tip: Use ggplot2’s lesser-used %+% operator compose ggpackets order handle duplicate arguments without throwing warnings. ggpackets use last-enterred argument build plot, allowing comfortable syntax intuitively set default value allowing user-flexibility. format, bit extra syntax, exposes quite lot new functionality. can use additional geometries adding plot standard ggplot fashion, can alter aesthetics intuitively can modify internals packed layers easily. see action, let’s take look can new function:
code: my_ggpk <- function(...) {   ggpacket(...) %+%    geom_bar(.id = 'bar',     fun.data = mean_se,     position = position_dodge(width = 1.0),     ...,     stat= 'summary') %+%        geom_errorbar(.id = 'errorbar',     fun.data = mean_se,     position = position_dodge(width = 1.0),     width = 0.2,     ...,     stat = 'summary') %+%    geom_label(.id = 'label',     position = position_dodge(width = 1.0),     vjust = -0.5, color = 'white',     alpha = 0.3, label.size = NA,     ...,     stat = 'summary',     fun.data = function(d) c(label = length(d), y = 0)) } ggplot(mtcars) +    aes(x = carb, y = mpg) +    my_ggpk(fun.data = mean_se, bar.mapping = aes(fill = carb)) f <- function(...) {   ggpacket(...) %+%              # all ... used as default for all layers     geom_bar(fill = "red") %+%   # overwrites any fill from ...     geom_bar(fill = "red", ...)  # allows ... to now mask the default }

title: Getting Started with `ggpackets`
code: ggplot(mtcars) +    aes(x = carb, y = wt, fill = vs) +    my_ggpk() +    facet_grid(. ~ vs, scales = 'free')

what: Multiple ggpackets can be used together
title: Getting Started with `ggpackets`
code: my_ggpk2 <- ggpacket() +    geom_ribbon(stat = 'summary', fun.data = mean_se, alpha = 0.2) +    geom_line(stat = 'summary', fun.data = mean_se, alpha = 0.3, size = 2)  ggplot(mtcars) +    aes(x = carb, y = wt) +    my_ggpk() +    my_ggpk2

what: Composing with ggplot annotations and themes
title: Getting Started with `ggpackets`
code: ggplot(mtcars) +    aes(x = carb, y = wt, fill = carb) +    my_ggpk() +    ggtitle('A beautiful ggpackets plot!') +    theme_light()

title: Miscellaneous Examples
code: ggpk_dot_matrix <- function(..., width = 10) {   ggpacket(...) %+%   geom_point(     data = . %>% mutate(       xvar = (1:nrow(.)-1) %%  width,        yvar = (1:nrow(.)-1) %/% width),     mapping = aes(x = xvar, y = yvar),      ...) %+%    theme_void() %+%    coord_fixed() } diamonds %>%    sample_frac(0.01) %>%   arrange(cut) %>%      ggplot() +      aes(color = cut) +      ggpk_dot_matrix(size = 3, width = 30)

title: Miscellaneous Examples
code: ggpk_tukey_ribbons <- function(...) {   ggpacket(...) %+%    # Tukey Box Edges   geom_ribbon(.id = "box",     mapping = aes(fill = ..color..),     stat = 'summary',     fun = median,     fun.min = ~quantile(., 0.25, names = FALSE),     fun.max = ~quantile(., 0.75, names = FALSE),     alpha = 0.15,      ...,     color = NA) %+%        # Tukey Whiskers   geom_ribbon(.id = "whisker",     mapping = aes(fill = ..color..),      stat = 'summary',     fun = median,     fun.min = ~.[head(which(. > quantile(., 0.25, names = FALSE) - 1.5 * IQR(.)), 1)],     fun.max = ~.[tail(which(. < quantile(., 0.75, names = FALSE) + 1.5 * IQR(.)), 1)],     alpha = 0.15,     ...,     color = NA) %+%    # Median Line   geom_line(.id = list(NULL, 'line'),     stat = 'summary',     fun = median,     alpha = 0.8,     ...) } economics_long %>%    filter(variable %in% c('pop', 'unemploy')) %>%   mutate(year = as.integer(format(as.Date(date, format="%Y-%m-%d"),"%Y"))) %>%      ggplot() + aes(x = year, y = value, color = variable) +      ggpk_tukey_ribbons() +     scale_y_log10()

title: Package Plot Layers for Easier Portability and Modularization
text: Define common ggplot layer sets together singled object. Connect plots single plot component definition debug one central location. Build beautiful templates save , reuse easily without abandon ggplot construction framework. Now can use template repeatedly much simpler ggplot call
code: ggpk_box_and_scatter <- ggpacket() +   geom_point(position = position_jitter(width = 0.4), alpha = 0.02) +    geom_boxplot(outlier.shape = NA, fill = NA, color = 'black') +    geom_text(stat = 'summary', vjust = -1, fun.data = function(d) c(     y = quantile(d, 0.75, names = F) + 1.5 * IQR(d),     label = length(d)   )) +    theme_linedraw() +    scale_color_distiller(palette = "Set1") ggplot(diamonds, aes(x = cut, y = price, color = carat)) +    ggpk_box_and_scatter() +    ggtitle('Diamond price distribution by cut')

title: Package Plot Layers for Easier Portability and Modularization
text: addition simply wrapping multiple ggplot2 layers, ggpackets can streamline number complicated plotting scenarios passing arguments sets layers, setting default argument values scoped overrides, routing aesthetic mappings reused within specific layers aesthetics scoping data usage set layers. function make use number specialized behaviors. .id parameters set tag specific layers identifier, can used prefix arguments route subset ggpacket layers. Multiple IDs can used, arguments filter layer match provided IDs. Ellipsis first passed ggpacket(...), pass default values ggpacket layers. Ellipsis also passed tail end layer call, allowing arguments mask default values. placement ellipsis determines whether arguments override overridden existing parameters. expanding ellipsis, last instance argument used build call. Aesthetics rerouted using specialized ..<aesthetic>.. syntax. use %+% instead commonly-used + add layers together, allows ggpackets accept non-standard arguments ggplot sends us warnings .
code: ggpk_labelled_heatmap <- function(...) {   ggpacket(...) %+%     geom_tile(.id = 'tile', color = NA, ...) %+%      geom_text(.id = c("text", "text1"), color = "black", vjust = -0.3,        fontface = "bold", ...) %+%     geom_text(.id = c("text", "text2"),        aes(label = sprintf("(%.1f)", ..fill..)),        color = "black", vjust = 1.1, ...) %+%     theme_void() } ggplot(as.data.frame(OrchardSprays)) +    aes(x = rowpos, y = colpos, label = treatment, fill = decrease) +    ggpk_labelled_heatmap(text.color = "white", text2.alpha = 0.5) +    ggtitle('Honeybee population decline in repellent trial grid')

title: A container for lazy ggplot layers — ggpacket
A container for lazy ggplot layers — ggpacket
text: ... Arguments passed ggpacket_call data data argument use layers within ggpacket mapping aesthetic mapping use basis layers within ggpacket. Layer-specific mappings update value mapping, assigning ..reset.. aesthetic field return propegated aesthetic mapping default, unmapped state layer. .id optional identifier tag ggpacket, used filtering arguments aesthetics propegated contained ggplot layers.

title: A container for lazy ggplot layers — ggpacket
text: ggpacket object behaves like function, returning updated ggpacket. well, contains slots can used programmatically accessing lazy ggplot calls. Within ggpacket subsequent ggplot layer calls, aesthetic mappings can contain references previously mapped aesthetics using double-dot keywords (e.g. ..x..). addition, keyword ..reset.. can used revert aesthetics within ggpacket layer un-specified state. ggpackets tolerate flexible syntax layer specifications, preferrable use ggplot composition operator %+% (instead +). allows duplicate argument names non-standard aesthetics passed, handled internally within ggpacket call, trigger warnings using bare +.

title: A container for lazy ggplot layers — ggpacket
text: data lazy reference data parameter ggpacket, allowing scoping data used block ggplot layers. mapping lazy reference mapping parameter ggpacket, allowing scoping aesthetic mappings block ggplot layers. dots Quosures representing arguments passed ggpacket's ggplot layers. ggcalls list containing layers stored within ggpacket

title: A container for lazy ggplot layers — ggpacket
code: library(ggplot2)  # create a ggpacket directly, setting some fixed argument settings ggpk_simple <- ggpacket() %+% geom_line(color = "red") %+% geom_point() ggplot(mtcars, aes(x = wt, y = mpg)) + ggpk_simple()   # any non-fixed arguments can be modified in the ggpacket call ggplot(mtcars, aes(x = wt, y = mpg)) + ggpk_simple(color = "green")   # arguments can be specified for only specific layers by prefixing them ggplot(mtcars, aes(x = wt, y = mpg)) + ggpk_simple(point.size = 5)   # allow masking of preset arguments by wrapping the ggpacket in a function ggpk_func <- function(...) {   ggpacket() %+%     geom_line(...) %+%     geom_point(color = "red", ...) }  ggplot(mtcars, aes(x = wt, y = mpg)) +   ggpk_func(color = "purple", size = 2, point.size = 4)

title: ggpackets: Package Plot Layers for Easier Portability and Modularization — ggpackets-package
code: # Prep a tidy data.frame to plot with airquality_long <- rbind(   data.frame(     airquality[,c("Month", "Day")],     Variable = "Temp",     Measurement = airquality$Temp),   data.frame(     airquality[,c("Month", "Day")],     Variable = "Ozone",     Measurement = airquality$Ozone))  # Build our new composite ggplot geom geom_error_line <- ggpacket() %+%   geom_ribbon(     .id = "box",     mapping = aes(fill = ..color..),     stat = 'summary',     fun = mean,     fun.min = ~mean(.) - sd(.),     fun.max = ~mean(.) + sd(.),     alpha = 0.15,     color = NA) %+%   geom_line(     .id = "line",     stat = 'summary',     fun = mean,     alpha = 0.8)  # Try it out! ggplot(airquality_long) +   aes(x = round((Month * 30 + Day) / 4), y = Measurement, color = Variable) +   geom_error_line(na.rm = TRUE, line.size = 1.5) +   scale_y_log10() +   labs(x = "Week")   # for further examples, check out the vignettes vignette(package = "ggpackets") #> no vignettes found
